alert.note: Alert for Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 02 at 9:07AM EST until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CST /1115 AM EST/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Gadsden and Liberty. In Panhandle Florida, Calhoun. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM CST /1115 AM EST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 807 AM CST /907 AM EST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blountstown, Quincy, Greensboro, Bristol, Rock Bluff, Roy, Selman, Nettle Ridge, Durham, Kennys Mill, Juniper, Blountstown Airport, Chipola, Red Oak, Sawdust and Clarksville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
